content: Investments Stocks Discussion Asked by AnonymousAsked on 14 May 2019(Stocks Discussion) SGX: PCI Limited [SGX: P19.SI]?Discuss anything about PCI Limited SGX: P19.SI share price, dividends, yield, ratios, fundamentals, technical analysis and if you would buy or sell this stock on the SGX Singapore markets. Do take note that the answers given by our members are just your opinions, so please do your own due diligence before making an investment in PCI Limited SGX: P19.SI1 answerAnswerBump1
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Isaac Chan, Business  at NUSLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 14 May 2019TL;DR The firm's financials look good and seem to be priced at a cheap valuation. I do think that a deeper analysis is probably more necessary to find out if this share is a good buy by studying their growth profile. Source: Supply Chain Digital Business Profile Source: PCI LimitedHeadquartered in Singapore, PCI Private Limited is a specialist in electronics manufacturing services. They deliver quality end-to-end manufacturing supply chain solutions that create competitive advantages for leading technology companies worldwide. They ensure that their global clientele receive the quickest time to market possible at the right price and performance points, and with the highest standards.Income StatementAs a whole, the margins of the business looks quite alright. EBITDA and Gross Profit margin look bad, but EBIT and net profit seem alright due to the low depreciation and amortization that they have. Year on Year, the earnings have improved by quite a big jump as well. Overall, financials look like they have been improving year on year. Balance SheetThe firm's balance sheet looks quite good too! Short-term liquidity looks quite high. Moreover, the firm does not hold much debt, which suggests that more cashflows can be left for shareholders. However, it also does seem that short-term liquidity had slowly worsened over the years.CashflowsA whole, the firm's cash flows look pretty good. This is evidenced by their good free cash flow as % of sales, while cash flows have also improved over the years as well. Finally, the firm looks like they have quite a good foundation of paying out and sustaining their dividends as well. This is evidenced by their high free cash flow to equity and zero debt levels, as well as the relatively high cash balance they have. Efficiency MetricsThe firm looks quite efficient as well, base on the different efficiency metrics. Moreover, these metrics had also improved over time. ValuationOverall, the firm looks to have good valuation as well, and the firm does seem to be trading at potentially a discount. Overall, the Free Cashflow Yield and Free Cashflow to Equity Yield are also high. This means that the firm's investors are getting good cash flow returns. ​​​
